alert.note: Alert for Louisa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 11:58PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Henderson, northwestern Warren, southern Rock Island, Mercer, northeastern Des Moines and southeastern Louisa Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1158 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Keithsburg, or 10 miles southwest of Aledo, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Millersburg and Seaton around 1205 AM CDT. Aledo around 1210 AM CDT. Burgess around 1215 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Viola, Matherville, Shale City and Boden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern and west central Illinois...and southeastern Iowa.
